fields.name: Author
fields.description: The creator of the content item.

fields.name: Categories
fields.description: Categories for the solution content item

fields.name: ContentId
fields.description: Static ID for the content.  Used to identify dependencies and content from solutions or community.  Hard-coded/static for out of the box content and solutions. Dynamic for user-created.  This is the resource name

fields.name: Dependencies
fields.description: Dependencies for the content item, what other content items it requires to work.  Can describe more complex dependencies using a recursive/nested structure. For a single dependency an id/kind/version can be supplied or operator/criteria for complex formats.

fields.name: FirstPublishDate
fields.description: first publish date solution content item

fields.name: Kind
fields.description: The kind of content the metadata is for.

fields.name: LastPublishDate
fields.description: last publish date for the solution content item

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: Full parent resource ID of the content item the metadata is for.  This is the full resource ID including the scope (subscription and resource group)

fields.name: Providers
fields.description: Providers for the solution content item

fields.name: Source
fields.description: Source of the content.  This is where/how it was created.

fields.name: Support
fields.description: Support information for the metadata - type, name, contact information

fields.name: Version
fields.description: Version of the content.  Default and recommended format is numeric (e.g. 1, 1.0, 1.0.0, 1.0.0.0), following ARM template best practices.  Can also be any string, but then we cannot guarantee any version checks
